results.content: Excellent course - clear, well-planned and executed and easy to follow. Great job!
results.content_html: Excellent course - clear, well-planned and executed and easy to follow. Great job!

results.content: Found it hard to follow along. It was like there were steps missing in between the teaching that meant that I couldn't get the code to work, i.e., it assumed a level of knowledge about how to do what is obvious to the teacher but not to me as the student. The upfront stuff about getting the different asynchronous bits working in the browser were fine (followed those), then it got hard once we moved into Django. Just couldn't get things working. Had to fight on my own too much.
results.content_html: Found it hard to follow along. It was like there were steps missing in between the teaching that meant that I couldn't get the code to work, i.e., it assumed a level of knowledge about how to do what is obvious to the teacher but not to me as the student. The upfront stuff about getting the different asynchronous bits working in the browser were fine (followed those), then it got hard once we moved into Django. Just couldn't get things working. Had to fight on my own too much.

results.content: Love this guy! It's like he reached into my mind and found my wish list of courses and then made them all lol
results.content_html: Love this guy! It's like he reached into my mind and found my wish list of courses and then made them all lol

results.content: Really like the content, wish I would have learned this sooner, to make django feel a little more modern in my websites. Not many are teaching this. Only thing I wish is that it was more javascript than jquery but that's ok, it can be transferred later, once I get the hang of the new process of using ajax instead of Django's basic views
